article:
Generically, a 'Galilean' is an inhabitant of Galilee. 'Galileans' (or
'GalilÃ¦ans') were also the members of a fanatical sect (Zealots), followers of
Judas of Galilee, who fiercely resented the taxation of the Romans, and whose
violence contributed to induce the latter to vow the extermination of the whole
race. The term was used by late antique pagan reactionaries such as the Emperor
Julian as a contemptuous synonym for Christian.
headings: The Galilee up until the time of Jesus
